publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4516 Mr Frank McAveety: A Proactive Calton Joins Campaign for a Better East End—That the Parliament congratulates all those involved in the organisation of the Calton Information Day, held at St James’ Primary School on 6 July 2009; commends the work of the Calton Area Association and its office bearers in bringing together the community of Calton to identify ways in which Calton can share in the wider regeneration of the east end of Glasgow, and calls on all partner agencies and elected members to work together to ensure that the community of Calton can make a contribution to the ongoing improvements to the east end of Glasgow.

S3M-4516 Mr Frank McAveety: A Proactive Calton Joins Campaign for a Better East End—That the Parliament congratulates all those involved in the organisation of the Calton Information Day, held at St James’ Primary School on 6 July 2009; commends the work of the Calton Area Association and its office bearers in bringing together the community of Calton to identify ways in which Calton can share in the wider regeneration of the east end of Glasgow, and calls on all partner agencies and elected members to work together to ensure that the community of Calton can make a contribution to the ongoing improvements to the east end of Glasgow.
S3M-4516 A Proactive Calton Joins Campaign for a Better East End (lodged on 25 June 2009) Jackie Baillie*
